page.title: 07 Lamberhurst Forges
page.content: The{watermill}was built by "The Great Ditch" at Hoathly in 1548 and became famous as the{ironworks}that made the railings and gateways of{St. {Pauls Cathedral}in London between 1709 and 1741. The railings weighed about 200 tons. Other railings made here are at Hastings, Lewes Castle and Toronto in Canada. The mill owners were in trouble at one time with the government because the mill made cannon casts for the British Navy and they were smuggling them to France. Part of St. Paul's railings are now outside the Village Hall. The mill is now a horse stud. The{Forge}was built on School Hill in 1850. The{blacksmith said that his work varied with what people paid him to do. He does gas and electronic welding. The furnace can reach 300 degrees centigrade. He does repair farm machinery and shoe horses.
